content.question: The contrabass (string bass) is notated an octave higher than the sounding pitch. Which of the following statements about the score above is true?

choices.label: The contrabass and cello are in unison.
The contrabass and cello sound an octave apart.
The cello and viola parts are in unison.
The cello plays in parallel thirds with the viola.

content.answer: The contrabass and cello are in unison.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
